sourceMeaningMnemonic: When you drive a <radical>car</radical>, everyone under your <radical>roof</radical> is putting their <radical>life</radical> in your hands, even if they don't say it with their <radical>mouth</radical>—it's still under your <kanji>control</kanji>.
meaningInfo: It's really important to remember how many things are under your control when you operate a vehicle. It isn't just the people in your car either, it's everyone and everything in your way too.
readingMnemonic: You have to maintain <kanji>control</kanji> of your car or you'll hit a bunch of <reading>cats</reading> (<ja>かつ</ja>). The roads are full of cats at all times. And if you lose control of your car for just a second, you'll hit at least two or three cats.
readingInfo: If you don't want to think about hitting adorable cats with your car, you better maintain control. You're responsible!
